overview: GitHub is officially supporting using your Copilot Pro, Pro+, Business, or Enterprise subscription with OpenCode.

detailed_explanation.title: Overview
bullets: GitHub is officially supporting using your Copilot Pro, Pro+, Business, or Enterprise subscription with OpenCode.
GitHub Copilot now fully supports authentication with OpenCode through a formal partnership, allowing you to use your existing Copilot subscription across more of your development workflow.

detailed_explanation.title: What is OpenCode?
bullets: OpenCode is an open source agent that helps you write code in your terminal, IDE, or desktop. You can learn more at OpenCode’s site .

detailed_explanation.title: How it works
bullets: Getting started with OpenCode and GitHub Copilot is simple:
In OpenCode, run /connect and select GitHub Copilot .
Complete the GitHub device login flow.
Start using OpenCode powered by Copilot.

detailed_explanation.title: Who can use this feature
bullets: All developers with paid GitHub Copilot subscriptions (Pro, Pro+, Business, or Enterprise) can now authenticate into OpenCode using their Copilot credentials—no additional AI license needed.
Learn more about OpenCode’s Copilot provider setup .
Join the discussion within GitHub Community .
